013package org.apache.juneau.junit.bct;
014
015import static java.util.stream.Collectors.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.junit.bct.Utils.*;
017import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.*;
018
019import java.util.*;
020import java.util.function.*;
021import java.util.stream.*;
022
023import org.opentest4j.*;
024
025/**
026 * Comprehensive utility class for Bean-Centric Tests (BCT) and general testing operations.
027 *
028 * <p>This class extends the functionality provided by the JUnit Assertions class, with particular emphasis
029 * on the Bean-Centric Testing (BCT) framework. BCT enables sophisticated assertion patterns for
030 * testing object properties, collections, maps, and complex nested structures with minimal code.</p>
031 *
032 * <h5 class='section'>Bean-Centric Testing (BCT) Framework:</h5>
033 * <p>The BCT framework consists of several key components:</p>
034 * <ul>
035 *    <li><b>{@link BeanConverter}:</b> Core interface for object conversion and property access</li>
036 *    <li><b>{@link BasicBeanConverter}:</b> Default implementation with extensible type handlers</li>
037 *    <li><b>Assertion Methods:</b> High-level testing methods that leverage the converter framework</li>
038 * </ul>
039 *
040 * <h5 class='section'>Primary BCT Assertion Methods:</h5>
041 * <dl>
042 *    <dt><b>{@link #assertBean(Object, String, String)}</b></dt>
043 *    <dd>Tests object properties with nested syntax support and collection iteration</dd>
044 *
045 *    <dt><b>{@link #assertBeans(Collection, String, String...)}</b></dt>
046 *    <dd>Tests collections of objects by extracting and comparing specific fields</dd>
047 *
048 *    <dt><b>{@link #assertMapped(Object, java.util.function.BiFunction, String, String)}</b></dt>
049 *    <dd>Tests custom property access using BiFunction for non-standard objects</dd>
050 *
051 *    <dt><b>{@link #assertList(List, Object...)}</b></dt>
052 *    <dd>Tests list/collection elements with varargs for expected values</dd>
053 * </dl>
054 *
055 * <h5 class='section'>BCT Advanced Features:</h5>
056 * <ul>
057 *    <li><b>Nested Property Syntax:</b> "address{street,city}" for testing nested objects</li>
058 *    <li><b>Collection Iteration:</b> "#{address{street,city}}" syntax for testing all elements</li>
059 *    <li><b>Universal Size Properties:</b> "length" and "size" work on all collection types</li>
060 *    <li><b>Array/List Access:</b> Numeric indices for element-specific testing</li>
061 *    <li><b>Method Chaining:</b> Fluent setters can be tested directly</li>
062 *    <li><b>Direct Field Access:</b> Public fields accessed without getters</li>
063 *    <li><b>Map Key Access:</b> Including special <js>"&lt;null&gt;"</js> syntax for null keys</li>
064 * </ul>
065 *
066 * <h5 class='section'>Converter Extensibility:</h5>
067 * <p>The BCT framework is built on the extensible {@link BasicBeanConverter} which allows:</p>
068 * <ul>
069 *    <li><b>Custom Stringifiers:</b> Type-specific string conversion logic</li>
070 *    <li><b>Custom Listifiers:</b> Collection-type conversion for iteration</li>
071 *    <li><b>Custom Swappers:</b> Object transformation before conversion</li>
072 *    <li><b>Custom PropertyExtractors:</b> Property extraction</li>
073 *    <li><b>Configurable Settings:</b> Formatting, delimiters, and display options</li>
074 * </ul>
075 *
076 * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
077 *
078 * <p><b>Basic Property Testing:</b></p>
079 * <p class='bjava'>
080 *    <jc>// Test multiple properties</jc>
081 *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>user</jv>, <js>"name,age,active"</js>, <js>"John,30,true"</js>);
082 *
083 *    <jc>// Test nested properties - user has getAddress() returning Address with getStreet() and getCity()</jc>
084 *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>user</jv>, <js>"name,address{street,city}"</js>, <js>"John,{123 Main St,Springfield}"</js>);
085 * </p>
086 *
087 * <p><b>Collection and Array Testing:</b></p>
088 * <p class='bjava'>
089 *    <jc>// Test collection size and iterate over all elements - order has getItems() returning List&lt;Product&gt; where Product has getName()</jc>
090 *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>order</jv>, <js>"items{length,#{name}}"</js>, <js>"{3,[{Laptop},{Phone},{Tablet}]}"</js>);
091 *
092 *    <jc>// Test specific array elements - listOfData is a List&lt;DataObject&gt; where DataObject has getData()</jc>
093 *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>listOfData</jv>, <js>"0{data},1{data}"</js>, <js>"{100},{200}"</js>);
094 * </p>
095 *
096 * <p><b>Collection Testing:</b></p>
097 * <p class='bjava'>
098 *    <jc>// Test list elements</jc>
099 *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(tags, <js>"red"</js>, <js>"green"</js>, <js>"blue"</js>);
100 *
101 *    <jc>// Test map entries using assertBean</jc>
102 *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>config</jv>, <js>"timeout,retries"</js>, <js>"30000,3"</js>);
103 * </p>
104 *
105 * <p><b>Custom Property Access:</b></p>
106 * <p class='bjava'>
107 *    <jc>// Test with custom accessor function</jc>
108 *    <jsm>assertMapped</jsm>(<jv>myObject</jv>, (<jp>obj</jp>, <jp>prop</jp>) -> <jp>obj</jp>.getProperty(<jp>prop</jp>),
109 *       <js>"prop1,prop2"</js>, <js>"value1,value2"</js>);
110 * </p>
111 *
112 * <h5 class='section'>Performance and Thread Safety:</h5>
113 * <p>The BCT framework is designed for high performance with:</p>
114 * <ul>
115 *    <li><b>Caching:</b> Type-to-handler mappings cached for fast lookup</li>
116 *    <li><b>Thread Safety:</b> All operations are thread-safe for concurrent testing</li>
117 *    <li><b>Minimal Allocation:</b> Efficient object reuse and minimal temporary objects</li>
118 * </ul>
119 *
120 * @see BeanConverter
121 * @see BasicBeanConverter
122 */
123public class BctAssertions {
124
125   private static final BeanConverter DEFAULT_CONVERTER = BasicBeanConverter.DEFAULT;
126
127   private BctAssertions() {}
128
129   /**
130    * Creates a new {@link AssertionArgs} instance for configuring assertion behavior.
131    *
132    * <p>AssertionArgs provides fluent configuration for customizing assertion behavior, including:</p>
133    * <ul>
134    *    <li><b>Custom Messages:</b> Static strings, parameterized with <code>MessageFormat</code>, or dynamic suppliers</li>
135    *    <li><b>Custom Bean Converters:</b> Override default object-to-string conversion behavior</li>
136    *    <li><b>Timeout Configuration:</b> Set timeouts for operations that may take time</li>
137    * </ul>
138    *
139    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
140    * <p class='bjava'>
141    *    <jc>// Static message</jc>
142    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jsm>args</jsm>().setMessage(<js>"User validation failed"</js>),
143    *       <jv>user</jv>, <js>"name,age"</js>, <js>"John,30"</js>);
144    *
145    *    <jc>// Parameterized message</jc>
146    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jsm>args</jsm>().setMessage(<js>"Test failed for user {0}"</js>, <jv>userId</jv>),
147    *       <jv>user</jv>, <js>"status"</js>, <js>"ACTIVE"</js>);
148    *
149    *    <jc>// Dynamic message with supplier</jc>
150    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jsm>args</jsm>().setMessage(() -> <js>"Test failed at "</js> + Instant.<jsm>now</jsm>()),
151    *       <jv>result</jv>, <js>"success"</js>, <js>"true"</js>);
152    *
153    *    <jc>// Custom bean converter</jc>
154    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>converter</jv> = BasicBeanConverter.<jsm>builder</jsm>()
155    *       .defaultSettings()
156    *       .addStringifier(LocalDate.<jk>class</jk>, <jp>date</jp> -> <jp>date</jp>.format(DateTimeFormatter.<jsf>ISO_LOCAL_DATE</jsf>))
157    *       .build();
158    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jsm>args</jsm>().setBeanConverter(<jv>converter</jv>),
159    *       <jv>event</jv>, <js>"date"</js>, <js>"2023-12-01"</js>);
160    * </p>
161    *
162    * @return A new AssertionArgs instance for fluent configuration
163    * @see AssertionArgs
164    */
165   public static AssertionArgs args() {
166      return new AssertionArgs();
167   }
168
169   /**
170    * Asserts that the fields/properties on the specified bean are the specified values after being converted to strings.
171    *
172    * <p>This is the primary method for Bean-Centric Tests (BCT), supporting extensive property validation
173    * patterns including nested objects, collections, arrays, method chaining, direct field access, collection iteration
174    * with <js>"#{property}"</js> syntax, and universal <js>"length"</js>/<js>"size"</js> properties for all collection types.</p>
175    *
176    * <p>The method uses the {@link BasicBeanConverter#DEFAULT} converter internally for object introspection
177    * and value extraction. The converter provides sophisticated property access through the {@link BeanConverter}
178    * interface, supporting multiple fallback mechanisms for accessing object properties and values.</p>
179    *
180    * <h5 class='section'>Basic Usage:</h5>
181    * <p class='bjava'>
182    *    <jc>// Test multiple properties</jc>
183    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"prop1,prop2,prop3"</js>, <js>"val1,val2,val3"</js>);
184    *
185    *    <jc>// Test single property</jc>
186    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"name"</js>, <js>"John"</js>);
187    * </p>
188    *
189    * <h5 class='section'>Nested Property Testing:</h5>
190    * <p class='bjava'>
191    *    <jc>// Test nested bean properties</jc>
192    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"name,address{street,city,state}"</js>, <js>"John,{123 Main St,Springfield,IL}"</js>);
193    *
194    *    <jc>// Test arbitrarily deep nesting</jc>
195    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"name,person{address{geo{lat,lon}}}"</js>, <js>"John,{{{40.7,-74.0}}}"</js>);
196    * </p>
197    *
198    * <h5 class='section'>Array, List, and Stream Testing:</h5>
199    * <p class='bjava'>
200    *    <jc>// Test array/list elements by index - items is a String[] or List&lt;String&gt;</jc>
201    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"items{0,1,2}"</js>, <js>"{item1,item2,item3}"</js>);
202    *
203    *    <jc>// Test nested properties within array elements - orders is a List&lt;Order&gt; where Order has getId() and getTotal()</jc>
204    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"orders{0{id,total}}"</js>, <js>"{{123,99.95}}"</js>);
205    *
206    *    <jc>// Test array length property - items can be any array or collection type</jc>
207    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"items{length}"</js>, <js>"{5}"</js>);
208    *
209    *    <jc>// Works with any iterable type including Streams - userStream returns a Stream&lt;User&gt; where User has getName()</jc>
210    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"userStream{#{name}}"</js>, <js>"[{Alice},{Bob}]"</js>);
211    * </p>
212    *
213    * <h5 class='section'>Collection Iteration Syntax:</h5>
214    * <p class='bjava'>
215    *    <jc>// Test properties across ALL elements in a collection using #{...} syntax - userList is a List&lt;User&gt; where User has getName()</jc>
216    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"userList{#{name}}"</js>, <js>"[{John},{Jane},{Bob}]"</js>);
217    *
218    *    <jc>// Test multiple properties from each element - orderList is a List&lt;Order&gt; where Order has getId() and getStatus()</jc>
219    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"orderList{#{id,status}}"</js>, <js>"[{123,ACTIVE},{124,PENDING}]"</js>);
220    *
221    *    <jc>// Works with nested properties within each element - customers is a List&lt;Customer&gt; where Customer has getAddress() returning Address with getCity()</jc>
222    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"customers{#{address{city}}}"</js>, <js>"[{{New York}},{{Los Angeles}}]"</js>);
223    *
224    *    <jc>// Works with arrays and any iterable collection type (including Streams)</jc>
225    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>config</jv>, <js>"itemArray{#{type}}"</js>, <js>"[{String},{Integer},{Boolean}]"</js>);
226    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>data</jv>, <js>"statusSet{#{name}}"</js>, <js>"[{ACTIVE},{PENDING},{CANCELLED}]"</js>);
227    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>processor</jv>, <js>"dataStream{#{value}}"</js>, <js>"[{A},{B},{C}]"</js>);
228    * </p>
229    *
230    * <h5 class='section'>Universal Collection Size Properties:</h5>
231    * <p class='bjava'>
232    *    <jc>// Both 'length' and 'size' work universally across all collection types</jc>
233    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"myArray{length}"</js>, <js>"{5}"</js>);        <jc>// Arrays</jc>
234    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"myArray{size}"</js>, <js>"{5}"</js>);          <jc>// Also works for arrays</jc>
235    *
236    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"myList{size}"</js>, <js>"{3}"</js>);           <jc>// Collections</jc>
237    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"myList{length}"</js>, <js>"{3}"</js>);         <jc>// Also works for collections</jc>
238    *
239    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"myMap{size}"</js>, <js>"{7}"</js>);            <jc>// Maps</jc>
240    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"myMap{length}"</js>, <js>"{7}"</js>);          <jc>// Also works for maps</jc>
241    * </p>
242    *
243    * <h5 class='section'>Class Name Testing:</h5>
244    * <p class='bjava'>
245    *    <jc>// Test class properties (prefer simple names for maintainability)</jc>
246    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"obj{class{simpleName}}"</js>, <js>"{{MyClass}}"</js>);
247    *
248    *    <jc>// Test full class names when needed</jc>
249    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"obj{class{name}}"</js>, <js>"{{com.example.MyClass}}"</js>);
250    * </p>
251    *
252    * <h5 class='section'>Method Chaining Support:</h5>
253    * <p class='bjava'>
254    *    <jc>// Test fluent setter chains (returns same object)</jc>
255    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(
256    *       <jv>item</jv>.setType(<js>"foo"</js>).setFormat(<js>"bar"</js>).setDefault(<js>"baz"</js>),
257    *       <js>"type,format,default"</js>,
258    *       <js>"foo,bar,baz"</js>
259    *    );
260    * </p>
261    *
262    * <h5 class='section'>Advanced Collection Analysis:</h5>
263    * <p class='bjava'>
264    *    <jc>// Combine size/length, metadata, and content iteration in single assertions - users is a List&lt;User&gt;</jc>
265    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"users{length,class{simpleName},#{name}}"</js>,
266    *       <js>"{3,{ArrayList},[{John},{Jane},{Bob}]}"</js>);
267    *
268    *    <jc>// Comprehensive collection validation with multiple iteration patterns - items is a List&lt;Product&gt; where Product has getName() and getPrice()</jc>
269    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>order</jv>, <js>"items{size,#{name},#{price}}"</js>,
270    *       <js>"{3,[{Laptop},{Phone},{Tablet}],[{999.99},{599.99},{399.99}]}"</js>);
271    *
272    *    <jc>// Perfect for validation testing - verify error count and details; errors is a List&lt;ValidationError&gt; where ValidationError has getField() and getCode()</jc>
273    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>result</jv>, <js>"errors{length,#{field},#{code}}"</js>,
274    *       <js>"{2,[{email},{password}],[{E001},{E002}]}"</js>);
275    *
276    *    <jc>// Mixed collection types with consistent syntax - results and metadata are different collection types</jc>
277    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>response</jv>, <js>"results{size},metadata{length}"</js>, <js>"{25},{4}"</js>);
278    * </p>
279    *
280    * <h5 class='section'>Direct Field Access:</h5>
281    * <p class='bjava'>
282    *    <jc>// Test public fields directly (no getters required)</jc>
283    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"f1,f2,f3"</js>, <js>"val1,val2,val3"</js>);
284    *
285    *    <jc>// Test field properties with chaining</jc>
286    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"f1{length},f2{class{simpleName}}"</js>, <js>"{5},{{String}}"</js>);
287    * </p>
288    *
289    * <h5 class='section'>Map Testing:</h5>
290    * <p class='bjava'>
291    *    <jc>// Test map values by key</jc>
292    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"configMap{timeout,retries}"</js>, <js>"{30000,3}"</js>);
293    *
294    *    <jc>// Test map size</jc>
295    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"settings{size}"</js>, <js>"{5}"</js>);
296    *
297    *    <jc>// Test null keys using special &lt;null&gt; syntax</jc>
298    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"mapWithNullKey{&lt;null&gt;}"</js>, <js>"{nullKeyValue}"</js>);
299    * </p>
300    *
301    * <h5 class='section'>Collection and Boolean Values:</h5>
302    * <p class='bjava'>
303    *    <jc>// Test boolean values</jc>
304    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"enabled,visible"</js>, <js>"true,false"</js>);
305    *
306    *    <jc>// Test enum collections</jc>
307    *    <jsm>assertBean</jsm>(<jv>myBean</jv>, <js>"statuses"</js>, <js>"[ACTIVE,PENDING]"</js>);
308    * </p>
309    *
310    * <h5 class='section'>Value Syntax Rules:</h5>
311    * <ul>
312    *    <li><b>Simple values:</b> <js>"value"</js> for direct property values</li>
313    *    <li><b>Nested values:</b> <js>"{value}"</js> for single-level nested properties</li>
314    *    <li><b>Deep nested values:</b> <js>"{{value}}"</js>, <js>"{{{value}}}"</js> for multiple nesting levels</li>
315    *    <li><b>Array/Collection values:</b> <js>"[item1,item2]"</js> for collections</li>
316    *    <li><b>Collection iteration:</b> <js>"#{property}"</js> iterates over ALL collection elements, returns <js>"[{val1},{val2}]"</js></li>
317    *    <li><b>Universal size properties:</b> <js>"length"</js> and <js>"size"</js> work on arrays, collections, and maps</li>
318    *    <li><b>Boolean values:</b> <js>"true"</js>, <js>"false"</js></li>
319    *    <li><b>Null values:</b> <js>"null"</js></li>
320    * </ul>
321    *
322    * <h5 class='section'>Property Access Priority:</h5>
323    * <ol>
324    *    <li><b>Collection/Array access:</b> Numeric indices for arrays/lists (e.g., <js>"0"</js>, <js>"1"</js>)</li>
325    *    <li><b>Universal size properties:</b> <js>"length"</js> and <js>"size"</js> for arrays, collections, and maps</li>
326    *    <li><b>Map key access:</b> Direct key lookup for Map objects (including <js>"&lt;null&gt;"</js> for null keys)</li>
327    *    <li><b>is{Property}()</b> methods (for boolean properties)</li>
328    *    <li><b>get{Property}()</b> methods</li>
329    *    <li><b>Public fields</b> (direct field access)</li>
330    * </ol>
331    *
332    * @param actual The bean object to test. Must not be null.
333    * @param fields Comma-delimited list of property names to test. Supports nested syntax with {}.
334    * @param expected Comma-delimited list of expected values. Must match the order of fields.
335    * @throws NullPointerException if the bean is null
336    * @throws AssertionError if any property values don't match expected values
337    * @see BeanConverter
338    * @see BasicBeanConverter
339    */
340   public static void assertBean(Object actual, String fields, String expected) {
341      assertBean(args(), actual, fields, expected);
342   }
343
344   /**
345    * Same as {@link #assertBean(Object, String, String)} but with configurable assertion behavior.
346    *
347    * @param args Assertion configuration. See {@link #args()} for usage examples.
348    * @param actual The bean to test. Must not be null.
349    * @param fields A comma-delimited list of bean property names (supports nested syntax).
350    * @param expected The expected property values as a comma-delimited string.
351    * @see #assertBean(Object, String, String)
352    * @see #args()
353    */
354   public static void assertBean(AssertionArgs args, Object actual, String fields, String expected) {
355      assertNotNull(actual, "Actual was null.");
356      assertArgNotNull("args", args);
357      assertArgNotNull("fields", fields);
358      assertArgNotNull("expected", expected);
359      assertEquals(
360         expected,
361         tokenize(fields).stream().map(x -> args.getBeanConverter().orElse(DEFAULT_CONVERTER).getNested(actual, x)).collect(joining(",")),
362         args.getMessage("Bean assertion failed.")
363         );
364   }
365
366   /**
367    * Asserts that multiple beans in a collection have the expected property values.
368    *
369    * <p>This method validates that each bean in a collection has the specified property values,
370    * using the same property access logic as {@link #assertBean(Object, String, String)}.
371    * It's perfect for testing collections of similar objects or validation results.</p>
372    *
373    * <h5 class='section'>Basic Usage:</h5>
374    * <p class='bjava'>
375    *    <jc>// Test list of user beans</jc>
376    *    <jsm>assertBeans</jsm>(<jv>userList</jv>, <js>"name,age"</js>,
377    *       <js>"John,25"</js>, <js>"Jane,30"</js>, <js>"Bob,35"</js>);
378    * </p>
379    *
380    * <h5 class='section'>Complex Property Testing:</h5>
381    * <p class='bjava'>
382    *    <jc>// Test nested properties across multiple beans - orderList is a List&lt;Order&gt; where Order has getId() and getCustomer() returning Customer with getName() and getEmail()</jc>
383    *    <jsm>assertBeans</jsm>(<jv>orderList</jv>, <js>"id,customer{name,email}"</js>,
384    *       <js>"1,{John,john@example.com}"</js>,
385    *       <js>"2,{Jane,jane@example.com}"</js>);
386    *
387    *    <jc>// Test collection properties within beans - cartList is a List&lt;ShoppingCart&gt; where ShoppingCart has getItems() returning List&lt;Product&gt; and getTotal()</jc>
388    *    <jsm>assertBeans</jsm>(<jv>cartList</jv>, <js>"items{0{name}},total"</js>,
389    *       <js>"{{Laptop}},999.99"</js>,
390    *       <js>"{{Phone}},599.99"</js>);
391    * </p>
392    *
393    * <h5 class='section'>Validation Testing:</h5>
394    * <p class='bjava'>
395    *    <jc>// Test validation results</jc>
396    *    <jsm>assertBeans</jsm>(<jv>validationErrors</jv>, <js>"field,message,code"</js>,
397    *       <js>"email,Invalid email format,E001"</js>,
398    *       <js>"age,Must be 18 or older,E002"</js>);
399    * </p>
400    *
401    * <h5 class='section'>Collection Iteration Testing:</h5>
402    * <p class='bjava'>
403    *    <jc>// Test collection iteration within beans (#{...} syntax)</jc>
404    *    <jsm>assertBeans</jsm>(<jv>departmentList</jv>, <js>"name,employees{#{name}}"</js>,
405    *       <js>"Engineering,[{Alice},{Bob},{Charlie}]"</js>,
406    *       <js>"Marketing,[{David},{Eve}]"</js>);
407    * </p>
408    *
409    * <h5 class='section'>Parser Result Testing:</h5>
410    * <p class='bjava'>
411    *    <jc>// Test parsed object collections</jc>
412    *    <jk>var</jk> <jv>parsed</jv> = JsonParser.<jsf>DEFAULT</jsf>.parse(<jv>jsonArray</jv>, MyBean[].class);
413    *    <jsm>assertBeans</jsm>(<jsm>Arrays.asList</jsm>(<jv>parsed</jv>), <js>"prop1,prop2"</js>,
414    *       <js>"val1,val2"</js>, <js>"val3,val4"</js>);
415    * </p>
416    *
417    * @param actual The collection of beans to check. Must not be null.
418    * @param fields A comma-delimited list of bean property names (supports nested syntax).
419    * @param expected Array of expected value strings, one per bean. Each string contains comma-delimited values matching the fields.
420    * @throws AssertionError if the collection size doesn't match values array length or if any bean properties don't match
421    * @see #assertBean(Object, String, String)
422    */
423   public static void assertBeans(Object actual, String fields, String...expected) {
424      assertBeans(args(), actual, fields, expected);
425   }
426
427   /**
428    * Same as {@link #assertBeans(Object, String, String...)} but with configurable assertion behavior.
429    *
430    * @param args Assertion configuration. See {@link #args()} for usage examples.
431    * @param actual The collection of beans to test. Must not be null.
432    * @param fields A comma-delimited list of bean property names (supports nested syntax).
433    * @param expected Array of expected value strings, one per bean.
434    * @see #assertBeans(Object, String, String...)
435    * @see #args()
436    */
437   public static void assertBeans(AssertionArgs args, Object actual, String fields, String...expected) {
438      assertNotNull(actual, "Value was null.");
439      assertArgNotNull("args", args);
440      assertArgNotNull("fields", fields);
441      assertArgNotNull("expected", expected);
442
443      var converter = args.getBeanConverter().orElse(DEFAULT_CONVERTER);
444      var tokens = tokenize(fields);
445      var errors = new ArrayList<AssertionFailedError>();
446      var actualList = converter.listify(actual);
447
448      if (ne(expected.length, actualList.size())) {
449         errors.add(assertEqualsFailed(expected.length, actualList.size(), args.getMessage("Wrong number of beans.")));
450      } else {
451         for (var i = 0; i < actualList.size(); i++) {
452            var i2 = i;
453            var e = converter.stringify(expected[i]);
454            var a = tokens.stream().map(x -> converter.getNested(actualList.get(i2), x)).collect(joining(","));
455            if (ne(e, a)) {
456               errors.add(assertEqualsFailed(e, a, args.getMessage("Bean at row <{0}> did not match.", i)));
457            }
458         }
459      }
460
461      if (errors.isEmpty()) return;
462
463      var actualStrings = new ArrayList<String>();
464      for (var o : actualList) {
465         actualStrings.add(tokens.stream().map(x -> converter.getNested(o, x)).collect(joining(",")));
466      }
467
468      if (errors.size() == 1) throw errors.get(0);
469
470      throw assertEqualsFailed(
471         Stream.of(expected).map(Utils::escapeForJava).collect(joining("\", \"", "\"", "\"")),
472         actualStrings.stream().map(Utils::escapeForJava).collect(joining("\", \"", "\"", "\"")),
473         args.getMessage("{0} bean assertions failed:\n{1}", errors.size(), errors.stream().map(x -> x.getMessage()).collect(joining("\n")))
474         );
475   }
476
477   /**
478    * Asserts that mapped property access on an object returns expected values using a custom BiFunction.
479    *
480    * <p>This is designed for testing objects that don't follow
481    * standard JavaBean patterns or require custom property access logic. The BiFunction allows complete
482    * control over how properties are retrieved from the target object.</p>
483    *
484    * <p>This method creates an intermediate LinkedHashMap to collect all property values before
485    * using the same logic as assertBean for comparison. This ensures consistent ordering
486    * and supports the full nested property syntax. The {@link BasicBeanConverter#DEFAULT} is used
487    * for value stringification and nested property access.</p>
488    *
489    * @param <T> The type of object being tested
490    * @param actual The object to test properties on
491    * @param function The BiFunction that extracts property values. Receives (<jp>object</jp>, <jp>propertyName</jp>) and returns the property value.
492    * @param properties Comma-delimited list of property names to test
493    * @param expected Comma-delimited list of expected values (exceptions become simple class names)
494    * @throws AssertionError if any mapped property values don't match expected values
495    * @see #assertBean(Object, String, String)
496    * @see BeanConverter
497    * @see BasicBeanConverter
498    */
499   public static <T> void assertMapped(T actual, BiFunction<T,String,Object> function, String properties, String expected) {
500      assertMapped(args(), actual, function, properties, expected);
501   }
502
503   /**
504    * Same as {@link #assertMapped(Object, BiFunction, String, String)} but with configurable assertion behavior.
505    *
506    * @param <T> The object type being tested.
507    * @param args Assertion configuration. See {@link #args()} for usage examples.
508    * @param actual The object to test. Must not be null.
509    * @param function Custom property access function.
510    * @param properties A comma-delimited list of property names.
511    * @param expected The expected property values as a comma-delimited string.
512    * @see #assertMapped(Object, BiFunction, String, String)
513    * @see #args()
514    */
515   public static <T> void assertMapped(AssertionArgs args, T actual, BiFunction<T,String,Object> function, String properties, String expected) {
516      assertNotNull(actual, "Value was null.");
517      assertArgNotNull("args", args);
518      assertArgNotNull("function", function);
519      assertArgNotNull("properties", properties);
520      assertArgNotNull("expected", expected);
521
522      var m = new LinkedHashMap<String,Object>();
523      for (var p : tokenize(properties)) {
524         var pv = p.getValue();
525         m.put(pv, safe(() -> function.apply(actual, pv)));
526      }
527
528      assertBean(args, m, properties, expected);
529   }
530
531   /**
532    * Asserts that the string representation of an object contains the expected substring.
533    *
534    * <p>This method converts the actual object to its string representation using the current
535    * {@link BeanConverter} and then checks if it contains the expected substring. This is useful
536    * for testing partial content matches without requiring exact string equality.</p>
537    *
538    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
539    * <p class='bjava'>
540    *    <jc>// Test that error message contains key information</jc>
541    *    <jsm>assertContains</jsm>(<js>"FileNotFoundException"</js>, <jv>exception</jv>);
542    *
543    *    <jc>// Test that object string representation contains expected data</jc>
544    *    <jsm>assertContains</jsm>(<js>"status=ACTIVE"</js>, <jv>user</jv>);
545    *
546    *    <jc>// Test partial JSON/XML content</jc>
547    *    <jsm>assertContains</jsm>(<js>"\"name\":\"John\""</js>, <jv>jsonResponse</jv>);
548    * </p>
549    *
550    * @param expected The substring that must be present in the actual object's string representation
551    * @param actual The object to test. Must not be null.
552    * @throws AssertionError if the actual object is null or its string representation doesn't contain the expected substring
553    * @see #assertContainsAll(Object, String...) for multiple substring assertions
554    * @see #assertString(String, Object) for exact string matching
555    */
556   public static void assertContains(String expected, Object actual) {
557      assertContains(args(), expected, actual);
558   }
559
560   /**
561    * Same as {@link #assertContains(String, Object)} but with configurable assertion behavior.
562    *
563    * @param args Assertion configuration. See {@link #args()} for usage examples.
564    * @param expected The substring that must be present.
565    * @param actual The object to test. Must not be null.
566    * @see #assertContains(String, Object)
567    * @see #args()
568    */
569   public static void assertContains(AssertionArgs args, String expected, Object actual) {
570      assertArgNotNull("args", args);
571      assertArgNotNull("expected", expected);
572      assertArgNotNull("actual", actual);
573      assertNotNull(actual, "Value was null.");
574
575      var a = args.getBeanConverter().orElse(DEFAULT_CONVERTER).stringify(actual);
576      assertTrue(a.contains(expected), args.getMessage("String did not contain expected substring.  ==> expected: <{0}> but was: <{1}>", expected, a));
577   }
578
579   /**
580    * Asserts that the string representation of an object contains all specified substrings.
581    *
582    * <p>This method is similar to {@link #assertContains(String, Object)} but tests for multiple
583    * required substrings. All provided substrings must be present in the actual object's string
584    * representation for the assertion to pass.</p>
585    *
586    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
587    * <p class='bjava'>
588    *    <jc>// Test that error contains multiple pieces of information</jc>
589    *    <jsm>assertContainsAll</jsm>(<jv>exception</jv>, <js>"FileNotFoundException"</js>, <js>"config.xml"</js>, <js>"/etc"</js>);
590    *
591    *    <jc>// Test that user object contains expected fields</jc>
592    *    <jsm>assertContainsAll</jsm>(<jv>user</jv>, <js>"name=John"</js>, <js>"age=30"</js>, <js>"status=ACTIVE"</js>);
593    *
594    *    <jc>// Test log output contains all required entries</jc>
595    *    <jsm>assertContainsAll</jsm>(<jv>logOutput</jv>, <js>"INFO"</js>, <js>"Started"</js>, <js>"Successfully"</js>);
596    * </p>
597    *
598    * @param actual The object to test. Must not be null.
599    * @param expected Multiple substrings that must all be present in the actual object's string representation
600    * @throws AssertionError if the actual object is null or its string representation doesn't contain all expected substrings
601    * @see #assertContains(String, Object) for single substring assertions
602    */
603   public static void assertContainsAll(Object actual, String...expected) {
604      assertContainsAll(args(), actual, expected);
605   }
606
607   /**
608    * Same as {@link #assertContainsAll(Object, String...)} but with configurable assertion behavior.
609    *
610    * @param args Assertion configuration. See {@link #args()} for usage examples.
611    * @param actual The object to test. Must not be null.
612    * @param expected Multiple substrings that must all be present.
613    * @see #assertContainsAll(Object, String...)
614    * @see #args()
615    */
616   public static void assertContainsAll(AssertionArgs args, Object actual, String...expected) {
617      assertArgNotNull("args", args);
618      assertArgNotNull("expected", expected);
619      assertNotNull(actual, "Value was null.");
620
621      var a = args.getBeanConverter().orElse(DEFAULT_CONVERTER).stringify(actual);
622      var errors = new ArrayList<AssertionFailedError>();
623
624      for (var e : expected) {
625         if (!a.contains(e)) {
626            errors.add(assertEqualsFailed(true, false, args.getMessage("String did not contain expected substring.  ==> expected: <{0}> but was: <{1}>", e, a)));
627         }
628      }
629
630      if (errors.isEmpty()) return;
631
632      if (errors.size() == 1) throw errors.get(0);
633
634      var missingSubstrings = new ArrayList<String>();
635      for (var e : expected) {
636         if (!a.contains(e)) {
637            missingSubstrings.add(e);
638         }
639      }
640
641      throw assertEqualsFailed(
642         missingSubstrings.stream().map(Utils::escapeForJava).collect(joining("\", \"", "\"", "\"")),
643         Utils.escapeForJava(a),
644         args.getMessage("{0} substring assertions failed:\n{1}", errors.size(), errors.stream().map(x -> x.getMessage()).collect(joining("\n")))
645      );
646   }
647
648   /**
649    * Asserts that a collection-like object or Optional is not null and empty.
650    *
651    * <p>This method validates that the provided object is empty according to its type:</p>
652    * <ul>
653    *    <li><b>Optional:</b> Must be empty (not present)</li>
654    *    <li><b>Map:</b> Must have no entries</li>
655    *    <li><b>Collection-like objects:</b> Must be convertible to an empty List via {@link BeanConverter#listify(Object)}</li>
656    * </ul>
657    *
658    * <h5 class='section'>Supported Types:</h5>
659    * <p>Any object that can be converted to a List, including:</p>
660    * <ul>
661    *    <li>Collections (List, Set, Queue, etc.)</li>
662    *    <li>Arrays (primitive and object arrays)</li>
663    *    <li>Iterables, Iterators, Streams</li>
664    *    <li>Maps (converted to list of entries)</li>
665    *    <li>Optional objects</li>
666    * </ul>
667    *
668    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
669    * <p class='bjava'>
670    *    <jc>// Test empty collections</jc>
671    *    <jsm>assertEmpty</jsm>(Collections.<jsm>emptyList</jsm>());
672    *    <jsm>assertEmpty</jsm>(<jk>new</jk> ArrayList&lt;&gt;());
673    *
674    *    <jc>// Test empty arrays</jc>
675    *    <jsm>assertEmpty</jsm>(<jk>new</jk> String[0]);
676    *
677    *    <jc>// Test empty Optional</jc>
678    *    <jsm>assertEmpty</jsm>(Optional.<jsm>empty</jsm>());
679    *
680    *    <jc>// Test empty Map</jc>
681    *    <jsm>assertEmpty</jsm>(<jk>new</jk> HashMap&lt;&gt;());
682    * </p>
683    *
684    * @param value The object to test. Must not be null.
685    * @throws AssertionError if the object is null or not empty
686    * @see #assertNotEmpty(Object) for testing non-empty collections
687    * @see #assertSize(int, Object) for testing specific sizes
688    */
689   public static void assertEmpty(Object value) {
690      assertEmpty(args(), value);
691   }
692
693   /**
694    * Same as {@link #assertEmpty(Object)} but with configurable assertion behavior.
695    *
696    * @param args Assertion configuration. See {@link #args()} for usage examples.
697    * @param value The object to test. Must not be null.
698    * @see #assertEmpty(Object)
699    * @see #args()
700    */
701   public static void assertEmpty(AssertionArgs args, Object value) {
702      assertArgNotNull("args", args);
703      assertNotNull(value, "Value was null.");
704
705      if (value instanceof Optional<?> v2) {
706         assertTrue(v2.isEmpty(), "Optional was not empty");
707         return;
708      }
709
710      if (value instanceof Map<?,?> v2) {
711         assertTrue(v2.isEmpty(), "Map was not empty");
712         return;
713      }
714
715      var converter = args.getBeanConverter().orElse(DEFAULT_CONVERTER);
716
717      assertTrue(converter.canListify(value), args.getMessage("Value cannot be converted to a list.  Class=<{0}>", value.getClass().getSimpleName()));
718      assertTrue(converter.listify(value).isEmpty(), args.getMessage("Value was not empty."));
719   }
720
721   /**
722    * Asserts that a List or List-like object contains the expected values using flexible comparison logic.
723    *
724    * <h5 class='section'>Testing Non-List Collections:</h5>
725    * <p class='bjava'>
726    *    <jc>// Test a Set using l() conversion</jc>
727    *    Set&lt;String&gt; <jv>mySet</jv> = <jk>new</jk> TreeSet&lt;&gt;(Arrays.<jsm>asList</jsm>(<js>"a"</js>, <js>"b"</js>, <js>"c"</js>));
728    *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(<jsm>l</jsm>(<jv>mySet</jv>), <js>"a"</js>, <js>"b"</js>, <js>"c"</js>);
729    *
730    *    <jc>// Test an array using l() conversion</jc>
731    *    String[] <jv>myArray</jv> = {<js>"x"</js>, <js>"y"</js>, <js>"z"</js>};
732    *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(<jsm>l</jsm>(<jv>myArray</jv>), <js>"x"</js>, <js>"y"</js>, <js>"z"</js>);
733    *
734    *    <jc>// Test a Stream using l() conversion</jc>
735    *    Stream&lt;String&gt; <jv>myStream</jv> = Stream.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>);
736    *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(<jsm>l</jsm>(<jv>myStream</jv>), <js>"foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>);
737    * </p>
738    *
739    * <h5 class='section'>Comparison Modes:</h5>
740    * <p>The method supports three different ways to compare expected vs actual values:</p>
741    *
742    * <h6 class='section'>1. String Comparison (Readable Format):</h6>
743    * <p class='bjava'>
744    *    <jc>// Elements are converted to strings using the bean converter and compared as strings</jc>
745    *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(List.<jsm>of</jsm>(1, 2, 3), <js>"1"</js>, <js>"2"</js>, <js>"3"</js>);
746    *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(List.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"a"</js>, <js>"b"</js>), <js>"a"</js>, <js>"b"</js>);
747    * </p>
748    *
749    * <h6 class='section'>2. Predicate Testing (Functional Validation):</h6>
750    * <p class='bjava'>
751    *    <jc>// Use Predicate&lt;T&gt; for functional testing</jc>
752    *    Predicate&lt;Integer&gt; <jv>greaterThanOne</jv> = <jv>x</jv> -&gt; <jv>x</jv> &gt; 1;
753    *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(List.<jsm>of</jsm>(2, 3, 4), <jv>greaterThanOne</jv>, <jv>greaterThanOne</jv>, <jv>greaterThanOne</jv>);
754    *
755    *    <jc>// Mix predicates with other comparison types</jc>
756    *    Predicate&lt;String&gt; <jv>startsWithA</jv> = <jv>s</jv> -&gt; <jv>s</jv>.startsWith(<js>"a"</js>);
757    *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(List.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"apple"</js>, <js>"banana"</js>), <jv>startsWithA</jv>, <js>"banana"</js>);
758    * </p>
759    *
760    * <h6 class='section'>3. Object Equality (Direct Comparison):</h6>
761    * <p class='bjava'>
762    *    <jc>// Non-String, non-Predicate objects use <jsm>Objects.equals</jsm>() comparison</jc>
763    *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(List.<jsm>of</jsm>(1, 2, 3), 1, 2, 3); <jc>// Integer objects</jc>
764    *    <jsm>assertList</jsm>(List.<jsm>of</jsm>(<jv>myBean1</jv>, <jv>myBean2</jv>), <jv>myBean1</jv>, <jv>myBean2</jv>); <jc>// Custom objects</jc>
765    * </p>
766    *
767    * @param actual The List to test. Must not be null.
768    * @param expected Multiple arguments of expected values.
769    *                 Can be Strings (readable format comparison), Predicates (functional testing), or Objects (direct equality).
770    * @throws AssertionError if the List size or contents don't match expected values
771    */
772   public static void assertList(Object actual, Object...expected) {
773      assertList(args(), actual, expected);
774   }
775
776   /**
777    * Same as {@link #assertList(Object, Object...)} but with configurable assertion behavior.
778    *
779    * @param args Assertion configuration. See {@link #args()} for usage examples.
780    * @param actual The List to test. Must not be null.
781    * @param expected Multiple arguments of expected values.
782    * @see #assertList(Object, Object...)
783    * @see #args()
784    */
785   public static void assertList(AssertionArgs args, Object actual, Object...expected) {
786      assertArgNotNull("args", args);
787      assertArgNotNull("expected", expected);
788      assertNotNull(actual, "Value was null.");
789
790      var converter = args.getBeanConverter().orElse(DEFAULT_CONVERTER);
791      var list = converter.listify(actual);
792      var errors = new ArrayList<AssertionFailedError>();
793
794      if (ne(expected.length, list.size())) {
795         errors.add(assertEqualsFailed(expected.length, list.size(), args.getMessage("Wrong list length.")));
796      } else {
797         for (var i = 0; i < expected.length; i++) {
798            var x = list.get(i);
799            var e = expected[i];
800            if (e instanceof String e2) {
801               if (ne(e2, converter.stringify(x))) {
802                  errors.add(assertEqualsFailed(e2, converter.stringify(x), args.getMessage("Element at index {0} did not match.", i)));
803               }
804            } else if (e instanceof Predicate e2) {  // NOSONAR
805               if (!e2.test(x)) {
806                  errors.add(new AssertionFailedError(args.getMessage("Element at index {0} did not pass predicate.  ==> actual: <{1}>", i, converter.stringify(x)).get()));
807               }
808            } else {
809               if (ne(e, x)) {
810                  errors.add(assertEqualsFailed(e, x, args.getMessage("Element at index {0} did not match.  ==> expected: <{1}({2})> but was: <{3}({4})>", i, e, t(e), x, t(x))));
811               }
812            }
813         }
814      }
815
816      if (errors.isEmpty()) return;
817
818      var actualStrings = new ArrayList<String>();
819      for (var o : list) {
820         actualStrings.add(converter.stringify(o));
821      }
822
823      if (errors.size() == 1) throw errors.get(0);
824
825      throw assertEqualsFailed(
826         Stream.of(expected).map(converter::stringify).map(Utils::escapeForJava).collect(joining("\", \"", "[\"", "\"]")),
827         actualStrings.stream().map(Utils::escapeForJava).collect(joining("\", \"", "[\"", "\"]")),
828         args.getMessage("{0} list assertions failed:\n{1}", errors.size(), errors.stream().map(x -> x.getMessage()).collect(joining("\n")))
829      );
830   }
831
832   /**
833    * Asserts that a collection-like object or Optional is not null and not empty.
834    *
835    * <p>This method validates that the provided object is not empty according to its type:</p>
836    * <ul>
837    *    <li><b>Optional:</b> Must be present (not empty)</li>
838    *    <li><b>Map:</b> Must have at least one entry</li>
839    *    <li><b>Collection-like objects:</b> Must convert to a non-empty List via {@link BeanConverter#listify(Object)}</li>
840    * </ul>
841    *
842    * <h5 class='section'>Supported Types:</h5>
843    * <p>Any object that can be converted to a List, including:</p>
844    * <ul>
845    *    <li>Collections (List, Set, Queue, etc.)</li>
846    *    <li>Arrays (primitive and object arrays)</li>
847    *    <li>Iterables, Iterators, Streams</li>
848    *    <li>Maps (converted to list of entries)</li>
849    *    <li>Optional objects</li>
850    * </ul>
851    *
852    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
853    * <p class='bjava'>
854    *    <jc>// Test non-empty collections</jc>
855    *    <jsm>assertNotEmpty</jsm>(List.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"item1"</js>, <js>"item2"</js>));
856    *    <jsm>assertNotEmpty</jsm>(<jk>new</jk> ArrayList&lt;&gt;(Arrays.<jsm>asList</jsm>(<js>"a"</js>)));
857    *
858    *    <jc>// Test non-empty arrays</jc>
859    *    <jsm>assertNotEmpty</jsm>(<jk>new</jk> String[]{<js>"value"</js>});
860    *
861    *    <jc>// Test present Optional</jc>
862    *    <jsm>assertNotEmpty</jsm>(Optional.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"value"</js>));
863    *
864    *    <jc>// Test non-empty Map</jc>
865    *    <jsm>assertNotEmpty</jsm>(Map.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"key"</js>, <js>"value"</js>));
866    * </p>
867    *
868    * @param value The object to test. Must not be null.
869    * @throws AssertionError if the object is null or empty
870    * @see #assertEmpty(Object) for testing empty collections
871    * @see #assertSize(int, Object) for testing specific sizes
872    */
873   public static void assertNotEmpty(Object value) {
874      assertNotEmpty(args(), value);
875   }
876
877   /**
878    * Same as {@link #assertNotEmpty(Object)} but with configurable assertion behavior.
879    *
880    * @param args Assertion configuration. See {@link #args()} for usage examples.
881    * @param value The object to test. Must not be null.
882    * @see #assertNotEmpty(Object)
883    * @see #args()
884    */
885   public static void assertNotEmpty(AssertionArgs args, Object value) {
886      assertArgNotNull("args", args);
887      assertNotNull(value, "Value was null.");
888
889      if (value instanceof Optional<?> v2) {
890         assertFalse(v2.isEmpty(), "Optional was empty");
891         return;
892      }
893
894      if (value instanceof Map<?,?> v2) {
895         assertFalse(v2.isEmpty(), "Map was empty");
896         return;
897      }
898
899      assertFalse(args.getBeanConverter().orElse(DEFAULT_CONVERTER).listify(value).isEmpty(), args.getMessage("Value was empty."));
900   }
901
902   /**
903    * Asserts that a collection-like object or string is not null and of the specified size.
904    *
905    * <p>This method can validate the size of various types of objects:</p>
906    * <ul>
907    *    <li><b>String:</b> Validates character length</li>
908    *    <li><b>Collection-like objects:</b> Any object that can be converted to a List via the underlying converter</li>
909    * </ul>
910    *
911    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
912    * <p class='bjava'>
913    *    <jc>// Test string length</jc>
914    *    <jsm>assertSize</jsm>(5, <js>"hello"</js>);
915    *
916    *    <jc>// Test collection size</jc>
917    *    <jsm>assertSize</jsm>(3, List.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"a"</js>, <js>"b"</js>, <js>"c"</js>));
918    *
919    *    <jc>// Test array size</jc>
920    *    <jsm>assertSize</jsm>(2, <jk>new</jk> String[]{<js>"x"</js>, <js>"y"</js>});
921    * </p>
922    *
923    * @param expected The expected size/length.
924    * @param actual The object to test. Must not be null.
925    * @throws AssertionError if the object is null or not the expected size.
926    */
927   public static void assertSize(int expected, Object actual) {
928      assertSize(args(), expected, actual);
929   }
930
931   /**
932    * Same as {@link #assertSize(int, Object)} but with configurable assertion behavior.
933    *
934    * @param args Assertion configuration. See {@link #args()} for usage examples.
935    * @param expected The expected size/length.
936    * @param actual The object to test. Must not be null.
937    * @see #assertSize(int, Object)
938    * @see #args()
939    */
940   public static void assertSize(AssertionArgs args, int expected, Object actual) {
941      assertArgNotNull("args", args);
942      assertNotNull(actual, "Value was null.");
943
944      if (actual instanceof String a) {
945         assertEquals(expected, a.length(), args.getMessage("Value not expected size.  value: <{0}>", a));
946         return;
947      }
948
949      var size = args.getBeanConverter().orElse(DEFAULT_CONVERTER).listify(actual).size();
950      assertEquals(expected, size, args.getMessage("Value not expected size."));
951   }
952
953   /**
954    * Asserts that an object's string representation exactly matches the expected value.
955    *
956    * <p>This method converts the actual object to its string representation using the current
957    * {@link BeanConverter} and performs an exact equality comparison with the expected string.
958    * This is useful for testing complete string output, formatted objects, or converted values.</p>
959    *
960    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
961    * <p class='bjava'>
962    *    <jc>// Test exact string conversion</jc>
963    *    <jsm>assertString</jsm>(<js>"John,30,true"</js>, <jv>user</jv>); <jc>// Assuming user converts to this format</jc>
964    *
965    *    <jc>// Test formatted dates or numbers</jc>
966    *    <jsm>assertString</jsm>(<js>"2023-12-01"</js>, <jv>localDate</jv>);
967    *
968    *    <jc>// Test complex object serialization</jc>
969    *    <jsm>assertString</jsm>(<js>"{name=John,age=30}"</js>, <jv>userMap</jv>);
970    *
971    *    <jc>// Test array/collection formatting</jc>
972    *    <jsm>assertString</jsm>(<js>"[red,green,blue]"</js>, <jv>colors</jv>);
973    * </p>
974    *
975    * @param expected The exact string that the actual object should convert to
976    * @param actual The object to test. Must not be null.
977    * @throws AssertionError if the actual object is null or its string representation doesn't exactly match expected
978    * @see #assertContains(String, Object) for partial string matching
979    * @see #assertMatchesGlob(String, Object) for pattern-based matching
980    */
981   public static void assertString(String expected, Object actual) {
982      assertString(args(), expected, actual);
983   }
984
985   /**
986    * Same as {@link #assertString(String, Object)} but with configurable assertion behavior.
987    *
988    * @param args Assertion configuration. See {@link #args()} for usage examples.
989    * @param expected The expected string value.
990    * @param actual The object to test. Must not be null.
991    * @see #assertString(String, Object)
992    * @see #args()
993    */
994   public static void assertString(AssertionArgs args, String expected, Object actual) {
995      assertArgNotNull("args", args);
996      assertNotNull(actual, "Value was null.");
997
998      assertEquals(expected, args.getBeanConverter().orElse(DEFAULT_CONVERTER).stringify(actual), args.getMessage());
999   }
1000
1001   /**
1002    * Asserts that an object's string representation matches the specified glob-style pattern.
1003    *
1004    * <p>This method converts the actual object to its string representation using the current
1005    * {@link BeanConverter} and then tests it against the provided glob-style pattern.
1006    * This is useful for testing string formats with simple wildcard patterns.</p>
1007    *
1008    * <h5 class='section'>Pattern Syntax:</h5>
1009    * <p>The pattern uses glob-style wildcards:</p>
1010    * <ul>
1011    *    <li><b>{@code *}</b> matches any sequence of characters (including none)</li>
1012    *    <li><b>{@code ?}</b> matches exactly one character</li>
1013    *    <li><b>All other characters</b> are treated literally</li>
1014    * </ul>
1015    *
1016    * <h5 class='section'>Usage Examples:</h5>
1017    * <p class='bjava'>
1018    *    <jc>// Test filename patterns</jc>
1019    *    <jsm>assertMatchesGlob</jsm>(<js>"user_*_temp"</js>, <jv>filename</jv>);
1020    *
1021    *    <jc>// Test single character wildcards</jc>
1022    *    <jsm>assertMatchesGlob</jsm>(<js>"file?.txt"</js>, <jv>fileName</jv>);
1023    *
1024    *    <jc>// Test combined patterns</jc>
1025    *    <jsm>assertMatchesGlob</jsm>(<js>"log_*_?.txt"</js>, <jv>logFile</jv>);
1026    * </p>
1027    *
1028    * @param pattern The glob-style pattern to match against.
1029    * @param value The object to test. Must not be null.
1030    * @throws AssertionError if the value is null or its string representation doesn't match the pattern
1031    * @see #assertString(String, Object) for exact string matching
1032    * @see #assertContains(String, Object) for substring matching
1033    * @see Utils#getGlobMatchPattern(String) for pattern compilation details
1034    */
1035   public static void assertMatchesGlob(String pattern, Object value) {
1036      assertMatchesGlob(args(), pattern, value);
1037   }
1038
1039   /**
1040    * Same as {@link #assertMatchesGlob(String, Object)} but with configurable assertion behavior.
1041    *
1042    * @param args Assertion configuration. See {@link #args()} for usage examples.
1043    * @param pattern The glob-style pattern to match against.
1044    * @param value The object to test. Must not be null.
1045    * @see #assertMatchesGlob(String, Object)
1046    * @see #args()
1047    */
1048   public static void assertMatchesGlob(AssertionArgs args, String pattern, Object value) {
1049      assertArgNotNull("args", args);
1050      assertArgNotNull("pattern", pattern);
1051      assertNotNull(value, "Value was null.");
1052
1053      var v = args.getBeanConverter().orElse(DEFAULT_CONVERTER).stringify(value);
1054      var m = getGlobMatchPattern(pattern).matcher(v);
1055      assertTrue(m.matches(), args.getMessage("Pattern didn''t match. ==> pattern: <{0}> but was: <{1}>", pattern, v));
1056   }
1057}
